DataElement.preferredName: Hematology Serum Creatinine Laboratory Procedure Upper Limit of Normal Integer::4 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 4 decimal place numeric laboratory value representing the upper level of the normal range of values of creatinine in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Examination of blood for Creatinine,  a constituent of muscle tissue, which is used to evaluate kidney glomerular filtration. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI):A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/28/12 - DEC released as it is being reused by other NHLBI projects.  2/9/12 - Retired as part of content cleanup activities per concurrence with Jenny Larkin (NHLBI).  8/2/07-DEC released per FBPP review team direction. Per MC, this DEC has been changed back to Released as our team reuses this DEC. AK 2/27/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Upper Limit of Normal Integer::4 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Upper Limit of Normal Integer::4 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:A number with no fractional part.::4:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
